intro: Pectinariella dasycarpa, commonly known as the hairy fruit pectinaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, erect stature and distinctive hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Pectinariella dasycarpa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal and inland arid environments.
